title: Man charged over incident at office of Labour MP Jess Phillips
text:
Man charged over incident at office of Labour MP Jess Phillips

A 36-year-old man has been charged in connection with a disturbance outside the constituency office of the Labour MP Jess Phillips.

Michael Roby, of Billesley in Birmingham, was arrested after police officers were called to the Birmingham Yardley MP’s premises in the Acocks Green area of the city on Thursday afternoon.

West Midlands police said Roby was charged on Friday with a section 5 public order offence and released on conditional bail.

He is due to appear at Birmingham magistrates court on 10 October.
description: Michael Roby, 36, accused of public order offence at Birmingham constituency office
